Which of the following statements is / are true?  
  
I. The number of French school students who have ever used cannabis is
greater than the expected value for independence between country and
cannabis use.  
  
II. The number of observed Dutch students who have ever used cannabis is
greater than the expected number of independence between country and
cannabis use.

Answerlist
----------
* Only statement I is true
* Only statement II is true
* Both statements are true
* Neither statement is correct.

Solution
========





concerning I: total 181/620=0.29 , thus 29% total yes.  
For France this would be 0.29\*160=46.7.  
Thus 56 (counted) is more than expected .  
Thus I is true  
  
Concerning II: for the Netherlands: 0.29\*150=43.5 to be expected if
country and cannabis use is independent.  
Thus 36 is less than expected.  
Thus II is not true.

Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
